facts.fact: The Kings and Pavillion theatres open
First Stagecoach run to Edinburgh. Still faster than Scotrail?
QE2 liner is launched from John Brown Shipbuilders in Clydebank. The last great liner built on the Clyde
Kingston Bridge section of M8 opens
Glasgow Subway is electrified. Previously worked by a cable pulley system
Burrell Collection opens in Pollock Park
Glasgow hosts the 20th Commonwealth Games
A fire destroys much of the Mackintosh building at Glasgow School of Art
Police helicopter crashes onto roof of Clutha pub killing 10 people
Hosts the UEFA Champions League final at Hampden Park. Real Madrid win
Awarded rights to hold 20th Commonwealth Games in 2014
Host the Glasgow Garden Festival. 4.3 million visitors attend in only 5 months
The Clyde Audotorium, affectionally known as The Armadillo, opens
The last Glasgow tram runs
Subway, affectionally known as the Clockwork Orange, reopens after a 3 year upgrade
The Glasgow Royal Concert Hall opens. Widely renowned as one of World's best halls
Glasgow is European City of Culture
66 people killed at Ibrox Stadium as a result of a crush. Second major disaster at Ibrox.
Celtic F.C. win the European Cup. First British club to do so
Rangers F.C. win the European Cup Winners Cup
German bombing raids decimate Clydebank and kill 528 people. Only 7 out of 12000 properties left undamaged.
Black Friday - Battle of George Square. Tanks deployed to quell rioting by workers striking for a 40-hour week
A clean water supply carrying water in aquaducts from Loch Katrine in the Trossachs is completed. Today it supplies 230 million of litres of water a day to the city
Plague hits the city, again!
University of Glasgow is established in High Street
Provan's Lordship (the oldest building in Glasgow) is built
Tenents open a new brewery in Glasgow
Glasgow Green becomes Europe's first public park
Population his 330000, an increase of 800 percent in just 70 years!
University of Glasgow opens new site at Gilmorehill
Rangers Football Club is founded
Celtic Football Club is founded
A fire decimates the Glasgow School of Art, 4 years after 2014 fire
